result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Angelia L Hoppe was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Adjustment Number: 18A 002572, Payable Number: 59906, Receipt Number: 18R 004666, Amount: $15.00

Defendant, Angelia L Hoppe appeared with Attorney Diane Carol Lowe.  Attorney Daniel Patrick Steffen appeared for the State.  Court calls case and appearances.  Atty Lowe speaks to the court. Count 2-Dismissed.  Amend JOC.  Atty Lowe speaks to the court.  Atty Lowe calls Atty Bruce Anderson to the stand. Clerk swears in Atty Anderson.  Atty Lowe begins questioning.  Nothing further. Cross from the State. Redirect from Atty Lowe. Recross from the State. Nothing further. Witness excused.  Atty Lowe calls defendant Angelia Hoppe to the stand. Clerk swears in Ms. Hoppe.  Atty Lowe begins questioning. Nothing further. Cross from the State.  Nothing further. Witness excused.  Court speaks to the parties. Atty Lowe speaks to the court.    Court denies motion of ineffective counsel.  Motion denied re: Mr. Gasner.  Re: motion to surpress statements made on the video-motion is denied. Nothing further.

Defendant, Angelia L Hoppe appeared my phone means with Attorney Diane Carol Lowe appearing in person.  Attorney Angeline E Winton appeared for the State.

Court recites case and appearances. Attorney Lowe requests machner hearing. No objection from State. Machner hearing is scheduled. Adjourned.  Hearing scheduled for September 10, 2018 at 03:00 pm.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Angelia L Hoppe in court with attorney Bruce Patrick Anderson.  Defendant Angelia L Hoppe in custody.  Thomas H Frost appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls case and appearances.  No additions or corrections to the PSI.  State speaks to the court re: sentencing.  Atty Anderson speaks re: sentencing.  Defendant speaks to the court.  Court speaks re: sentencing.
Sentencing---3 years probation. Conditions: Not to consume any alcohol. Not to enter an establishment that sells alcohol for consumption on premises.
Alcohol Assessment. Drivers Safety Plan. DL Revoked for 36 months. IID Required. Fine--$3,391.00   6 months county jail, Credit 54 days. Entitled to Good Time/Huber. Any and all other conditions the DOC imposes.

Defendant Angelia L Hoppe in court with attorney Bruce Patrick Anderson.  Defendant Angelia L Hoppe in custody.  Thomas H Frost appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
2:55 pm Court recites case & app; Atty A - bail modification request, completed PSI, no work release for work search, huber priv. requested if not released, reinstate SB, etc.; DA - factors to consider, HS graduation location?, conditions change - request cash component; COURT:  request for bail mod. denied, recites PSI recommendation, prior record recited.  Adj'd 3:03 p.m.
Sentencing hearing on June 20, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

2015 CF 91
State of Wisconsin vs. Angelia L. Hoppe					Hon. Eugene Harrington
Jury Trial April 28, 2016							Laurel Dean, Court Reporter
Thomas H. Frost appears for the State of Wisconsin
Bruce P. Anderson appears for the Defendant Angelia L. Hoppe

On record at 8:37am. Court calls case and appearances.  Court speaks re: the witnesses. Court speaks re: discovery. Court makes statement re: jury.  Court speaks to the def. re: prior convictions. Court will make finding re: number of prior convictions. Court finds the def. waives her right to have the jury decide her number of prior convictions.  The attorneys need to prepare a written stipulation re: the blood draw. State speaks re: video.  
9:00 Bailiff seats jurors.  Court calls case and appearances. Clerk swears in all jury. Court reviews case with Jury.  Court begins questioning the jury. Court questions Juror Fritz. Juror Pank speaks to court.  Juror Pank is excused.  Clerk seats juror Jacobs. Court continues questioning. Juror Conaway speaks to the court.  Juror Plaza speaks to the court. Juror Vogt speaks to the court.  Juror Conaway speaks to the court.  Juror De Ladi speaks to the court. Court questions re: Jury service in the past. Juror Jacobs make statement.  Juror Ferguson, Juror Vogt and Juror Powers make statements. Juror Ferguson is excused.  Juror Steines is seated. Juror Powers makes statement.  Juror Richter, Juror Conaway, Juror Riley, Juror De Ladi, Juror Hansen, Juror Powers makes statement.   Attorneys exercise their strikes.  Court calls 12 Jurors, clerk swears in Jury.  Court excuses panel members. Stipulation between parties to play video, witnesses will be sequestered. Off record at 9:48.  
On record at 10:03. Jury returns, Court speaks to the Jury re: Jury instructions. State begins opening statement.  Atty Anderson reserves his right to his opening statement. State calls Officer Tanner Olek to the stand. Clerk swears in Officer Olek.  State begins questioning.  Cross from Atty Anderson.  Court asks Jury to stand down. Court speaks to state re: an objection.  State speaks to the court.  Atty Anderson speaks to the court.  Court makes findings.  Jury returns, Atty Anderson continues questioning.  Jury stands down. Atty Anderson raises issues. Court speaks to the parties.  State speaks to the court. Objection is over ruled. Jury returns. Atty Anderson speaks re: exhibit 1.  1-received. Atty Anderson continues questioning Officer Olek. Atty Anderson moves to a mistrial.  Recess at 11:15. Back on record at 11:22. Motion for mistrial is denied.  Court speaks to the parties.  Jury returns.  Atty Anderson continues questioning. Redirect from the State. Counsel approaches bench.  Clerk adds pg. 2 to exhibit 1. State questions Officer Olek. No further questions from the State. Re-cross from Atty Anderson.  No further questions. State offers video to the jury. Off record. Jury is shown video.  Back on record at 12:03. Witness is excused.  Off record at 12:03 for lunch. 
Back on record at 1:20pm. State offers exhibit 2-DVD. 2 is received. Exhibit 3-stipulation, 3-received. State calls Inv. Jason Bartholomew to the stand. Clerk swears in the witness. State begins questioning.   No further questions from the State. Cross from Atty Anderson.  No further questions from Atty Anderson. Witness is excused.  State rests. Jury stands down. Motion to dismiss from Atty Anderson. Motion is denied.  Court speaks his findings.  Off record at 1:45pm.   Back on record at 1:50pm.  Atty Anderson gives his opening statement.  Jury stands down.  Court speaks to the defendant.  Court finds the def. has freely and knowingly waives her right to remain silent.  Atty Anderson calls Angelia L. Hoppe to the stand. Clerk swears in Ms. Hoppe.  Atty Anderson begins questioning.  State makes objection to the defendants testimony. Court sustains objections.  Atty Anderson continues questioning. Atty Anderson offers exhibits 4,5,6received.   No further questions from Atty Anderson. Cross from the State.  Court speaks to the witness. No further questions from the State.  Re-direct from Atty Anderson.  Nothing further from Atty Anderson. Re-cross from the State. Nothing further, witness is excused.  Evidence is closed.  Jury stands down. Court reviews JI with the attorneys. Off record at 2:32pm.  Back on record at 2:38. Court reads JI with the Jury.  State gives closing argument. Atty Anderson gives closing argument. Rebuttal from Atty Anderson.  Court reviews verdict.  Clerk gives oath to bailiff.  Jury gets the case. Jury stands down.  Court speaks to the parties re: Jury Instructions. Off record at 3:14.
03:50 Jury Returns with Verdict
Count 1-Guilty, Court receives the verdict.
Count 2-Guilty, Court receives the verdict. 
Court excuses Jury. Court speaks re: number of convictions. Court finds 4 prior convictions. Court finds this case to be the defendants 5th convictions.   Court revokes bail pending the DOC doing the PSI.  
Court orders a PSI.
Sentencing June 20 @ 1:30.
Attorney Bruce Patrick Anderson in court.  Thomas H Frost appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls case and appearances.  Trial is still a go.

Final pre-trial at 04-13-2016 11:45 am.
Jury trial at 04-28-2016 08:00 am.

Defendant, Angelia L Hoppe appeared with Attorney Bruce Patrick Anderson.  Attorney Angeline E Winton appeared for the State. Court calls case and appearances. No agreement. Set for trial.  Jury trial scheduled for April 28, 2016 at 08:00 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 13, 2016 at 11:45 am.

Defendant, Angelia L Hoppe appeared with Attorney Bruce Patrick Anderson.  Attorney Angeline E Winton appeared for the State.  Court calls case and appearances.  Atty Anderson speaks to the court.   Atty Winton speaks to the court. The def admits that she refused the draw. Adj' until November. Court accepts the stipulation.  Bail will continue.  Status conference scheduled for November 3, 2015 at 11:45 am.
Wavied reading. Not guilty plea is entered to both counts.   Bail will continue.

Defendant, Angelia L Hoppe appeared with Attorney Bruce Patrick Anderson.  Attorney Angeline E Winton appeared for the State.  Court calls case and and appearances.  State calls Officer Tanner Olek to the stand.  Clerk swears in the Officer. State continues questioning.  Court finds that the officer has identifed the def.  State continues questioning.   No further questions.  Atty Anderson questions the Officer. Nothing further. No redirect.  Witness is excused.  Atty Anderson speaks to the court.  No Argument.  Refusal hearing scheduled for October 6, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant, Angelia L Hoppe appeared with Attorney Bruce Patrick Anderson.  Attorney Thomas H Frost appeared for the State.  Court calls case and appearances.   Waived reading.  Waive time limits.  Prelim needed. Bail will continue.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 18, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
